noun.description: A measure taken to protect someone or something or to prevent something undesirable.
examples: there were multiple safeguards to prevent the accidental release of a virus

verb.description: Protect from harm or damage with an appropriate measure.
examples: low interest rates are offering the opportunity to safeguard their financial futures

origin: Late Middle English (denoting protection or safe conduct): from Old French sauve garde, from sauve safe + garde guard. Compare with sagger.
